Module kivakit.data.compression
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.string

Class HuffmanStringCodec

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.string.HuffmanStringCodec
All Implemented Interfaces:
Codec<String>, StringCodec
public class HuffmanStringCodec extends Object implements StringCodec
A Huffman compression codec where strings are treated as symbols instead of characters. Frequent strings in map data input, like "highway" can often be compressed to a single byte this way. Less frequent strings can be compressed one character at a time with a CharacterCodec like HuffmanCharacterCodec.

A Huffman string codec can be created by calling stringCodec(Symbols, Maximum) with a set of symbols and their frequencies and a maximum number of bits for the longest allowable code. A codec can also be loaded from a .codec file containing string frequencies with stringCodec(PropertyMap). For details on how to create codec symbols, see Symbols.

Note that this codec doesn't support escaping of symbols because symbols that cannot be encoded are instead encoded by a character codec. In the case of a symbol that can't be encoded, canEncode(String) will return false.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
